intro: Scaevola angulata, commonly known as the common scaevola, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is well adapted to sandy soils and salt-laden environments. Scaevola angulata has small, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
